teacherbio: Mrs. Armstrong has taught English as a second language for five years. She currently works in an American public school district in which 40% of students are ESL speakers. She holds a Bachelor of Arts degree from The University of Texas at Austin and certificates in TEFL (Teaching English as a Foreign Language) and TEYL (Teaching English to Young Learners).
up to 6 students per class (50 minutes): up to 6 students per class (50 minutes)
CEFR A1 is the first step in learning En: CEFR A1 is the first step in learning English. Students can understand and use basic words and sentences for everyday conversations.
CEFR A2 is the next level of English lan: CEFR A2 is the next level of English language learning, where learners can handle simple, everyday tasks and have basic conversations about familiar topics.
